message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.ET, cs.SE 

The paper proposes a stochastic model for solar generation using a Markov chain approach, which is relevant to the field of control systems (cs.SY) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for smart grid applications. The paper also discusses the use of the model for designing appropriate size of energy storage devices, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) for energy optimization. Additionally, the paper discusses the inter-temporal dependency of solar irradiance, which is relevant to the field of electrical engineering (cs.ET) for power system analysis. Finally, the paper proposes an algorithm for generating synthetic solar states, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE) for developing smart grid applications.
